_header: Too long for shame and all too long truly
Title(s): ‘This ioly tyme this fresshe first day of may’
_description:
Charles d’Orléans, ‘This ioly tyme this fresshe first day of may’, translated from the French (Champollion-Figeac (1842)
XChampollion-Figeac, Aime. Les Poesies du duc Charles d’Orleans. Paris, 1842, 102) — three 8-line stanzas (ababbcbc) and 5-line Envoy

BLHar682.First Lines:
TO longe for shame and all to longe trewlyMyn hert y se thee slepe
                    in displesere…
BLHar682.Last Lines:
…That this wolde make myn hert a poore martereThis ioly tyme
                    this fresshe first day of may
